com.newmainsoftech.spray.sprex.web.servlet.config

Class ViewResolverConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.newmainsoftech.spray.sprex.web.servlet.config.ViewResolverConfig
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ViewResolverConfigCase, org.springframework.beans.factory.Aware, org.springframework.context.ApplicationContextAware

    @Configuration
public class ViewResolverConfig
extends Object
implements ViewResolverConfigCase, org.springframework.context.ApplicationContextAware
    @Configuration implementation for view resolver configuration.
    This is for configuring the following view resolvers:
    • ContentNegotiatingViewResolver
    • StaticViewResolver
    • XmlViewResolver
    • InternalResourceViewResolver
      (Please note that you can have only one InternalResourceViewResolver bean per application.)
    Author:
    Arata.Y

      StaticViewResolver staticViewResolver()
      Factory method of StaticViewResolver bean for dependency injection.
      Returned StaticViewResolver bean will be used to resolve view for static resources under path being returned by getStaticResourceRootPath().
      ViewResolverDefinitionInjectorCase viewResolverDefinitionInjector()
      Instantiating ViewResolverDefinitionInjectorCase bean adds other view resolvers to application context.
      The ViewResolverDefinitionInjector (default implementation of ViewResolverDefinitionInjectorCase interface) will add the following view resolver beans: BeanNameViewResolver bean
      Adding BeanNameViewResolver bean by default because, as nature of JavaConfig, BeanNameViewResolver became to make more sense than XML config era.

      • getStaticResourceRootPath

        public String getStaticResourceRootPath()
        Override this to specify path to root folder of static resources other than default one what will be obtained as value of ViewResolverConfigCase.ViewResolverConfigCommonDefualtValue.StaticResourceRootPath.
        Specified by:
        getStaticResourceRootPath in interface ViewResolverConfigCase
        Returns:
        Path to root folder of static resources what will be used in StaticViewResolver bean to identify and yield view for static resource request.

      • staticViewResolver

        @Bean
public StaticViewResolver staticViewResolver()
        Factory method of StaticViewResolver bean for dependency injection.
        Returned StaticViewResolver bean will be used to resolve view for static resources under path being returned by getStaticResourceRootPath().
        Returns:
        StaticViewResolver bean.

      • addViewControllers

        public void addViewControllers(org.springframework.web.servlet.config.annotation.ViewControllerRegistry registry)
        Registers request mapping for static case (what do not involve no controller logic).
        In this default implementation, register a view controller for static resources under the path being returned by getStaticResourceRootPath() method with using the value of ViewResolverConfigCase.ViewResolverConfigCommonDefualtValue.StaticResourceViewName as the view name.
        If that is not preferable, then override this.
        Specified by:
        addViewControllers in interface ViewResolverConfigCase
        Parameters:
        registry -

      • getApplicationContext

        protected org.springframework.context.ApplicationContext getApplicationContext()

      • getWebApplicationContext

        protected org.springframework.web.context.WebApplicationContext getWebApplicationContext()

      • viewResolverDefinitionInjector

        @Bean
public ViewResolverDefinitionInjectorCase viewResolverDefinitionInjector()
        Instantiating ViewResolverDefinitionInjectorCase bean adds other view resolvers to application context.
        The ViewResolverDefinitionInjector (default implementation of ViewResolverDefinitionInjectorCase interface) will add the following view resolver beans:
        • BeanNameViewResolver bean
          Adding BeanNameViewResolver bean by default because, as nature of JavaConfig, BeanNameViewResolver became to make more sense than XML config era.
          Although, please be advised that BeanNameViewResolver itself is not aware of i18n support - thereby, it must be done by view level or controller level.
        • XmlViewResolver bean
          Adds XmlViewResolver bean only when view XML file exists. For more info, refer to ViewResolverDefinitionInjector class.
        If those do not fit to your preference, then override this method.
        Returns:
        Dummy bean instantiated for purpose of adding other view resolver beans to application context.
